page.title: 12OUGHTONHEAD COMMON, HITCHIN
page.content: Oughtonhead Common is situated about two miles North west of Hitchin town centre. The area is approximately 42 acres. The land cover is a mixture of woodland, marsh and rough grazing. It is surrounded by farmland. The Common is of huge importance to local residents for recreational activities. A published Nature Trail is available. There is some unofficial camping on the Common. Part of the Common has been designated a conservation Area and steps have been taken to protect it and encourage wild life. It includes a large area of marsh. It is hoped to re-introduce cattle to graze here.
